name: Stocks & Investments
intro: Zakat on stocks and shares is due if they are held for trade or investment and their value exceeds the nisab for a full lunar year. This ensures investment wealth is purified.

evidences.text: O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned...
No zakat is due on less than five awsuq of dates, nor less than five camels, nor less than five uqiyah of silver.

conditions: Owns stocks/shares above the nisab for one lunar year (hawl).
Held for trade or investment, not personal use.
calculation: If held for trade, pay zakat on full market value. If for investment, pay zakat on zakatable assets of the company (see annual reports).
example: Example: You own $10,000 in shares for trade. Pay 2.5% = $250. For investment, calculate zakatable assets proportionally.
madhhabNotes: All schools: Zakat is due on trade shares at market value. For investment, only on zakatable assets.

faq.q: Is zakat due on all shares?
faq.a: If for trade, yes. If for investment, only on zakatable assets. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/69912/zakaah-on-shares-in-companies

faq.q: How do I calculate zakat on investment shares?
faq.a: Check the company's annual report for zakatable assets. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/69912/zakaah-on-shares-in-companies
